item.description:
Well, I've been dying to setup a hike at Musquash once the bug season ended and it's finally here!

Park at the end of Hickory Hill Drive and head straight in to reach the trail entrance---- we can meet under the power lines.

To get to the trail head entrance on Hickory Hill Drive: When heading north towards Manchester, on Mammoth Road, take a left onto Shasta Drive (a country store with a Dunkin Donuts sign is right there). Stay on Shasta until it ends (about 1.2 miles) and take a left onto High Range Road. Stay on only short time, (about .3 miles) and take first street on right - Hickory Hill Drive. Go to the end of it and park .... trail head is right in front of where parking is.

I'd like it if we could meet a little ways away from parking - under the power lines - so the dogs don't interfere with others and we don't cause too much congestion in the surrounding neighborhood. The power lines are right before you get into the woods.

We can do The Betty Mac Trail which has been taking about an hour for Beau and I, probably about 1.5-2 hours with a group....
item.how_to_find_us: Meet under the power lines before trail head entrance

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Musquash - Hickory Hill Entrance
